{"step_by_step_thinking": "This patient's presentation is suggestive of precocious puberty, which is defined as the development of secondary sexual characteristics before the age of 8 in girls. The most common cause is idiopathic, but it can also be due to central nervous system abnormalities. Early closure of the epiphyseal growth plates due to the early surge of estrogen is a common complication of precocious puberty. This results in a decreased period of long bone growth and ultimately short stature in adulthood.", "answer_choice": "B. Short stature"}
